definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
to spur on/to urge on/to encourage sb (e.g. to make progress)
to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
lit. the whip cannot reach (idiom); beyond one's influence/too far to be able to help
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
to flog/to lash/to whip/to urge or goad along

sentences.english: Do not make a rod for your own Back.
sentences.chinese: 不要为你自己的脊背做一条笞鞭。

sentences.english: Goat penises kind of taste like Venison. They are low in fat and calories.

sentences.english: Therefore, he often whipped the ox to go faster when he arrived in the field.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他一到田里就时常用鞭抽打这头牛快走。

sentences.english: The effect of different salinities on the growth of Isochrysis sp. was studied.

sentences.english: Suitable for the connection in the left swing after the move is right inverse pendulum and the right leg whip.
